Package io.crums.sldg.db

Class MorselFile

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.db.MorselFile
public class MorselFile
extends java.lang.Object
A MorselPack serialized to a file.

Morsel files are assumed to fit in memory. In most cases, the majority of the space is taken not by the hash evidence of the ledger's rows, but by the contents that generated the input hashes for select rows (our Entry abstraction).

Limits

The maximum theoretical size of a morsel file is 2,147,483,647 bytes, just under 2GB. Anything approaching these sizes is likely to exhaust memory. Adding memory-mapped buffer capabilities would make sense then--and straight-forward right here.

  • Constructor Details

    • MorselFile

      public MorselFile​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException, ByteFormatException, HashConflictException
      Creates a new instance. Does not use a direct buffer.
      Parameters:
      file - the morsel file (suggest .mrsl extension)
      Throws:
      ByteFormatException - if the file format is malformed
      HashConflictException - if the file is somehow corrupted, then the hashes won't match
      java.io.IOException

    • MorselFile

      public MorselFile​(java.io.File file, boolean direct) throws java.io.IOException, ByteFormatException, HashConflictException
      Creates a new instance. Does not use a direct buffer.
      Parameters:
      file - the morsel file (suggest .mrsl extension)
      direct - if true then instance will be backed by a direct buffer (not a memory-mapped file buffer in either case)
      Throws:
      ByteFormatException - if the file format is malformed
      HashConflictException - if the file is somehow corrupted, then the hashes won't match
      java.io.IOException

  • Method Details

    • header

      public static java.nio.ByteBuffer header()
      Returns a read-only view of the expected file header. It reads MRSL 10 in ASCII.

    • createMorselFile

      public static java.io.File createMorselFile​(java.io.File target, MorselPackBuilder builder) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a new morsel file at the target file path using the given builder. If the target is a path to a non-existent file, then the file is written to the destination as given; if however the target is a path to a directory, then a file with a name generated from the characteristics of the given builder is returned.
      Parameters:
      target - target file or directory; null is interpreted as the current directory
      Returns:
      the file the morsel was written to
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getFile

      public final java.io.File getFile()
      Returns the file the instance was loaded from.

    • getMorselPack

      public final MorselPack getMorselPack()
      Returns the goodies.
